properties.areaDesc: Crawford, IL; Sullivan, IN; Clark, IL; Vigo, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 21 at 10:36AM EST until January 25 at 9:24AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

East Fork White River...Wabash River...White River...


.Minor to moderate flooding continues in central and southern Indiana
on the major rivers.  Primary crests will be/are comparable to those
that occurred in February and June of 2019.

The East Fork of the White River at Seymour is expected to fall
below flood stage Tuesday afternoon or evening.

Flooding along the lower portions of the White and Wabash Rivers
will continue into the weekend or early next week.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Wabash River at Terre Haute.
* until Saturday morning.
* At  9:30 AM Tuesday the stage was 21.0 feet. This is 2.0 to 2.5
feet higher than the observations from the old legacy gauge.
* Flood stage is 16.5 feet. This is 2.5 feet higher than flood stage
from the old legacy gauge.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It will continue to fall to below flood stage by Friday
evening.
* At 21.0 feet...The Wabash River extends to Interstate 70 Mile Marker
Number 4 from its west bank in the Terre Haute and West Terre Haute
area. All lakes in this area are affected by seep water and reach
capacity with some minor flooding.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
